Description: StarKist agreed to pay a civil penalty of $6.3 million to resolve allegations that it violated wastewater regulations at its facility in American Samoa.
Agency: Environmental Protection Agency referral to the Justice Department
Notes: Note: This penalty is a duplicate of an amount shown in another record (either because it applies to a multi-location settlement or because Violation Tracker contains an agency record and a settlement announcement for the same case).

Agency: Environmental Protection Agency referral to the Justice Department

Description: StarKist Co. and its subsidiary Starkist Samoa Co. were assessed $84,500 in penalties for violating the terms of a 2018 settlement designed to remedy deficiencies at their tuna processing facility in American Samoa.
Agency: Environmental Protection Agency referral to the Justice Department

Description: StarKist Co. was sentenced to pay a criminal fine of $100 million, the statutory maximum, for its role in a conspiracy to fix prices for canned tuna sold in the United States.  StarKist was also sentenced to a 13-month term of probation.

Bumble Bee Foods, Tri-Union Seafoods (which markets Chicken of the Sea) and StarKist agreed to pay $3.3 million to District Attorneys in Marin, Riverside and San Diego counties to resolve allegations that they failed to meet federal standards relating to the amount of fish in their cans of tuna. The announcement did not specify how much each company would pay. Here we assume the total was divided equally among the three.

Agency: South Coast (CA) Air Quality Management District
